items.title: House facades according to Feng Shui – wood, colour and interaction
items.summary: Just like the interior design, the exterior design of a property influences its holistic energetic effect. According to the teachings of Feng Shui, the proportions and shapes of houses reflect those of the body. The facade of an object represents the skin or the face…
items.content_html:
Just like the interior design, the exterior design of a property influences its holistic energetic effect. According to the teachings of Feng Shui, the proportions and shapes of houses reflect those of the body.

The facade of an object represents the skin or the face and – depending on its surface area – has a significant impact on the overall impression. This article shows the essential factors for a wooden facade according to Feng Shui principles.

The skin wants to breathe, the facade too!

The skin is the human organ that covers the largest surface area for sensory perception. Thanks to the associated surface sensitivity, humans can perceive vibrations, pressure, touch and temperatures, for example.

Just as the natural organ is important for maintaining health, houses also need a shell that enables an exchange of energy between the environment and the interior. 

If buildings are over-insulated, this exchange is not possible or only possible to a limited extent. Ideally, the insulation and the design of the house facade are directly included in the planning of the building according to Feng Shui . Materials and constructions as well as colors must be carefully selected.

Good to know: When compared to the human body, windows symbolize the eyes, the front door represents the mouth. The rooms inside the building represent the organs.

 

Wooden facades – use and maintain surfaces effectively

Wood is a popular facade material - not just in Feng Shui. As an element in the theory of harmony, the natural material stands for departure, growth, beginnings, spring, material prosperity and creativity. In order for the element to unfold its positive effect on the facade of buildings, the material should be recognizable and perceptible as such.

  • For example, if a wooden surface is painted in high-gloss white, the wood element cannot achieve its original effect according to Feng Shui.
  • A white painted facade corresponds to the element metal and therefore has a completely different character than the underlying material.
  • Knowledge of what a facade was originally made of is therefore not the only decisive factor for the effect of the building envelope.
  • Visual (seeing), olfactory (smelling) and haptic (feeling) perception are also elementary.

 

An untreated wooden facade retains its wooden character because the material is recognized and perceived as such. In addition to the smell and the color of the wood, the feel plays a role. When you touch the facade, you can feel the warm surface and the characteristic grain.

Wood protection without elemental changes if possible

If the wooden facade is to be protected from external influences such as rain, UV radiation and insects without affecting the perceptible effect of the material, breathable wood protection products such as glazes are a good option.

"In contrast to varnishes, wood protection glazes do not cover the wood surface and therefore also the grain. The wood protection glaze allows the wood to retain its natural appearance and ensures open pores so that the wood surface can continue to breathe . "

says the product information about the effective wood protection glaze from Baufix . The environmentally friendly wood gel from the specialist manufacturer of building protection products based in Heidelberg bears the "Blue Angel" environmental label. The moisture absorbed by the facade wood can be released again thanks to open-pored glazed facade wood - the facade and thus the skin of the building can breathe.

Weathered wood – easy to maintain, but requires intensive planning

A wooden facade without a protective coating develops a grey patina over the years, which gradually becomes darker. Natural wood changes its appearance significantly and this change should be taken into account during planning. The facade structure must be carefully chosen so that the effect remains positive even after years.

 

A significant factor is weathering and the possible color differences associated with it. A canopy or a projection can cause the wooden facade to have different colors on one side of the building. All areas that are less exposed to the weather remain lighter. Poorly positioned joints and slatted structures also contribute to the outer shell looking unsightly after just a few years.

Homeowners who want to save themselves a lot of work in advance make sure that the wooden facade can dry quickly after a downpour when planning the house. This requires forward-looking construction in harmony with the elements and cardinal directions.

 

Charred wood for refined facades

An alternative are pre-weathered wooden boards specifically for facades, which already have an elegant surface when purchased and promise less severe changes. 

An example of this is the wood with Yakisugi treatment , which is sold by the family-run wood producer Nakamoto Forestry from Japan. The wood for facade cladding is preserved by carbonization. In addition to completely black facades, the durable woods are available brushed so that the original wood colors remain visible.

Achieve the desired effect with colours

If a reduction in the wooden surface is desired, the facade can be designed in color. Depending on the color choice, the yin or yang effect of the building can be strengthened. 

If the goal is a Yin-emphasized facade, blue can be a possible color. But be careful: If a strong earth shape of a property meets the water represented by blue, disharmony can result. The reason is that the earth element absorbs water and destroys its power (also known as a collision). Such collisions are consistently avoided in a Feng Shui- compliant design, because otherwise unrest in perception or effect arises.

To achieve a balanced yin-yang character, all factors must be taken into account. The factors here do not just mean materials and colors, but also the residents who live in the property. It is therefore important to take stock and answer the key question of what the new facade paint should achieve.

Including:

  • To which element can the building be assigned based on its shape?
  • How does the house fit into the surroundings?
  • Which element can the environment be assigned to?
  • Should more energy be directed into the house?
  • Is mediation between the environment and the house desired?

When it comes to terraced houses in different colours, it is advisable to carefully consider the interactions. Depending on the colour combinations and house shapes, some houses can benefit from the interaction, while others (and therefore the residents) are negatively influenced.

  • Even rampant plants climbing along the facade or hanging plants reaching down from a balcony into the ground floor windows can significantly detract from the overall impression.
  • In order to direct positive, lively energy into the house, the facade color should not only match the surroundings. With the help of strong accents - for example in the form of a front door in a powerful color - the desired energy flows into the building.

The characters of the residents must also be taken into account when making the color scheme. For example, a homeowner who is born under the Feng Shui element ( Chinese zodiac sign ) of fire will hardly be attracted to a facade that primarily nourishes water elements.

With Feng Shui advice for new buildings, conflicts can be prevented and a pleasant living experience can be promoted right from the start.

items.title: Radiant shine – exploring the magical powers of a Feng Shui bracelet
items.summary: Feng Shui has been considered an art in China for centuries, enabling harmonious living. Feng Shui literally means wind and water. The knowledge of Feng Shui has now reached Europe and more and more people want to design their homes according to the rules of Feng Shui.
items.content_html:
Feng Shui has been considered an art in China for centuries, enabling harmonious living. Feng Shui literally means wind and water.

The knowledge of Feng Shui has now reached Europe and more and more people want to design their homes according to the rules of Feng Shui. But what exactly is Feng Shui? Can you really influence your luck? And how does it all work?

The effect of Feng Shui is proven by years of research and observation!

What is Feng Shui?

Feng Shui is an ancient Chinese art form that recognizes the interaction between spirit and matter. It is about harmonizing the flow of energy in our lives and thus freeing ourselves from disruptive factors.

By harmonizing our external environment, we can refocus our attention on our inner life and concentrate on our actual needs. 

An important part of Feng Shui are bracelets made of metal or stone. These so-called bangle bands are worn on certain parts of the skin and have the function of regulating the flow of energy in the body. This puts more strain on the body and strengthens it, which has a positive effect on our health.

Effect of the Feng Shui Bracelet

The Feng Shui bracelet is a special artifact that has a number of positive effects. It helps us discover and strengthen our magical powers.

It can improve our health and helps us achieve our dreams. The bracelet is a symbol of happiness and harmony. It helps us to be in harmony with ourselves and the world.

How does the bracelet work?

The functions of the bracelet are complex and can vary depending on the manufacturer and model. In general, however, the bracelet is seen as a talisman that brings positive energy into the wearer's life. It is said to bring good luck , health and prosperity. 

Through the combination of gemstones and motifs from Feng Shui, it is also intended to draw attention to certain aspects of life and thus focus on what is essential.

Areas of application of the Feng Shui bracelet

A Feng Shui bracelet is versatile and can be placed in the Feng Shui living room , the Feng Shui office or the garden. Depending on the purpose, the bracelet can be placed in different places. For example, the bracelet can be placed at the front door to regulate the flow of energy in the apartment. 

The Feng Shui bracelet can also have positive effects in the office. Its radiance can brighten up the room and improve the working atmosphere. The Feng Shui bracelet can also be used in the Feng Shui garden . Its magical powers can protect plants from negative influences and help them to become more vital and radiant.

Which stones should be used to achieve the best possible effect?

There are many different stones that can be used in a Feng Shui bracelet. To achieve the best possible effect, it is important to choose carefully. Each stone has its own magical powers and properties. It is important to read up on the meaning of each stone before choosing it. This will help to ensure that the bracelet has the desired effect. 

Some of the most commonly used stones in Feng Shui bracelets are: 

Jade: Jade is a very popular stone in Feng Shui. It is often referred to as a lucky stone and is known for its ability to attract good luck and wealth. Jade can also help promote harmony and balance. 

Crystal: Crystals are known for their healing properties. They can help cleanse and strengthen the body, mind and spirit. Crystals also have the ability to strengthen the aura and ward off negative energies. 

Tourmaline: Tourmaline is a very powerful stone. It is known for its ability to ward off negative energies and strengthen the aura. Tourmaline can also help cleanse the body, mind and soul.

An old saying in China says: a path between two people is a smile!

 

What are the benefits of wearing a Feng Shui bracelet?

One of the best things about a Feng Shui bracelet is that it helps us to understand our own magical powers. By wearing a bracelet that is tailored to our needs, we can use the positive properties of that bracelet to improve our lives. 

For example, a protection bracelet can help us feel safer and overcome our fears. Or a lucky bracelet can help us find more satisfaction in our lives.

Instructions for wearing the bracelet

The bracelet must be worn regularly to unleash its magical powers. Always wear it on your left hand and make sure it does not rub or pinch. The bracelet should never be removed unless you are in bed or bathing. When you wear the bracelet, you will feel it providing you with strength and positive energy. It will inspire you and help you achieve your goals.

  1. Place the bracelet on your wrist and fasten it tightly. 
  2. Make sure that the bracelet is not too tight and that it can be worn comfortably.
  3. If you want to wear the bracelet at night, you should loosen it so that it does not get stuck. 
  4. To achieve the best effect, the bracelet should be worn every day

Conclusion

Feng Shui bracelets are a wonderful way to boost the energy in your life. They improve your well-being and happiness. 

Although it is possible to discover all the details about the magical powers behind Feng Shui bracelets, to understand it you must experience the bracelet yourself. Join the club of those whose lives have changed for the better today. 

Combine the healing powers of nature with the ancient tradition of Feng Shui and increase your productivity and happiness.

Observe how you are doing and feel inside yourself.

items.title: Better quality of life through an individually furnished home
items.summary: A home where you feel comfortable and enjoy being is an essential prerequisite for a high quality of life and the most intense happiness possible. Different aspects such as lighting, wall design, decoration and the position of furniture affect the quality of living. More and…
items.content_html:
A home where you feel comfortable and enjoy being is an essential prerequisite for a high quality of life and the most intense happiness possible.

Different aspects such as lighting, wall design, decoration and the position of furniture affect the quality of living. More and more people are choosing to decorate their homes according to the rules of Feng Shui in order to benefit from positive energies.

I will explain to you which aspects need to be taken into account when furnishing your home in this way.

Happiness depends on two factors: you and your good indoor climate!

Rely on high-quality lighting

Lighting is very important in a home that has been decorated according to Feng Shui rules. Care should be taken to create light-filled rooms to avoid a feeling of being cramped.

It is particularly advisable to rely on natural light. Large windows are useful and the light can be individually controlled using curtains and blinds. In particular, the desk and places where you spend a lot of time, such as the Feng Shui living room, should receive a lot of natural light.

Alternatively, you can use different light sources to illuminate different living areas. It is advisable not to use just one large ceiling light, especially in the Feng Shui bedroom.

This does not meet the individual requirements for tailor-made lighting . Instead, you should always use floor lamps and wall lamps to illuminate a reading corner, for example, and create an ambience that makes you feel comfortable.

Decorate your walls creatively

There are many ways to influence the atmosphere and design of a room through the walls.

For example, many people use Beton Cire to give the plaster an attractive appearance and to use a high-quality and attractive finish . The nice thing about this type of wall design is that it is easy to maintain and moisture-resistant.

In addition, different wall colors can be used to give rooms a special look and to separate different living areas from each other.

It is also a good idea to work with attractive wallpapers in different patterns and with creative designs. This way, a room quickly gets an individual touch and can be adapted to your style and taste.

Another good strategy is to work with attractive moldings. A variety of wall designs can be used throughout the entire apartment, or you can decide to give each room its own look.

The right decoration

The design of an apartment according to the Feng Shui principle depends not only on the walls and a high-quality floor covering , but also the decorative elements play an important role.

These are crucial to the personality of a room and whether it looks modern, traditional, youthful, stylish or futuristic. There are many different decorative items that you can use to design a room.

Among the most popular decorative elements are wall pictures. Here you should choose ones that show positive and nature-related motifs.

Likewise, many people work with attractive figures that are placed on a sideboard or window sill. Another strategy is to work with mirrors.

These can make a room appear larger and give it a particularly bright and appealing touch. However, you should avoid hanging a mirror opposite a door and mirrors are not welcome in a Feng Shui bedroom.

Otherwise it will reflect the positive energy that comes into the room, meaning it cannot be used.

Choose round shapes

Nature is characterized by round shapes. From the largest planets, which are round and orbit the sun in round orbits, to atoms, which are round and also move in round orbits, all elements in the world are basically round.

Round shapes are part of human nature and should play a major role in our lives. That is why it is advisable to use round shapes and to avoid edges and corners in furniture as much as possible.

In addition, by building houses, humans have, to a certain extent, distanced themselves from their original living environment.

That is why, according to the Feng Shui principle, it is important to bring as many natural materials as possible into your living space. This makes it possible to stay in touch with your roots and origins, even in big cities and modern environments, and to achieve the highest possible quality of life in your own home.

There is an old Chinese saying: even if your house has a thousand rooms, you only need one to sleep in.

 

Working with plants

To ensure a high quality of life in your own home, it is advisable to have as many plants as possible.

These bring liveliness and naturalness into your living area and noticeably improve the air quality.

Plants are particularly useful in Feng Shui bedrooms when it comes to improving the room climate and helping you to fall asleep and sleep through the night. Plants also bring a variety of colors into your living area, making it bright and cheerful. 

When selecting plants, their individual characteristics must be taken into account so that they fit perfectly into your living area and personal lifestyle.

Red wood, for example, represents fire in plants. If you want to make your living space warm, passionate and full of joy , you should choose this color. Dark leaves, on the other hand, represent water and bring depth and mobility to the living area.

Pastel-colored flowers, on the other hand, represent metal, which stands for courage and concentration. The element earth is represented by yellow and earth-colored plants and brings stability into your own four walls.

Appeal to all senses as much as possible

Humans have five senses that allow them to perceive their surroundings and improve their quality of life. However, most people often focus too much on their sense of sight, so that the other senses do not reach their full potential.

When furnishing your own living area, you should therefore try to appeal to as many senses as possible .

This can be achieved, for example, through water elements, wind chimes and quiet music. This stimulates the sense of hearing and calms the body and soul .

It is also advisable to work with different room scents. These can provide serenity and relaxation, but can also have an invigorating effect. It is a good idea to have different scents available for different phases of life and different moods.

Conclusion

By designing your own living space, it is easy to influence your personal quality of life and well-being. It is a good idea to follow Feng Shui rules when designing your own four walls.

Particular consideration should be given to lighting, walls, decoration, shapes and plants.

items.title: “The Oracle Speaks” in the Chinese Almanac
items.summary: Every year there is a Chinese almanac. It contains a lot of information and describes what events the year will bring. It not only contains the "good days" for starting construction and moving in, but also a lot of traditional information about life. The moon allows many…
items.content_html:
Every year there is a Chinese almanac. It contains a lot of information and describes what events the year will bring. It not only contains the "good days" for starting construction and moving in, but also a lot of traditional information about life.

Each day has different qualities and can be assigned to certain events.

The almanac is used by the Chinese population for all life events.

You can use this reference book for a wide range of topics, including celebrations, meetings with important business partners, or cleaning the house, especially the altar. A good almanac will describe each individual Chinese zodiac sign's benefits for the day.

In the West we use the lunar calendar.

The lunar calendar tells you a lot, like when is the right day to go to the hairdresser? Some people swear that it makes their hair grow faster or that their hairstyle looks better overall.
But there are also reports that amaze us. If the Christmas tree is felled according to the lunar calendar, it does not lose its needles so quickly.

The moon allows many seeds to yield larger harvests and plants to thrive better. The Chinese almanac also relies on the signs of the moon, but always in conjunction with other important stars in the sky.

 

Almanac and Feng Shui together support favorable opportunities.

Relying solely on the calendar would be a superficial view of events. There are many other techniques in  Feng Shui to calculate favorable days for Feng Shui measures and moving into a new house . However, this requires the exact birth date of the respective house occupant and the exact orientation of the entire house.

If you stick to the “favorable times,” not only will the move go smoothly, but the Feng Shui consultations will also be more effective and, above all, have an immediate positive effect.

To calculate these times, most classical Feng Shui consultants use the solar calendar.

This provides a time frame for renovation work for each house . In order to calculate the time frame for renovation precisely, precise measurements must be taken using the Feng Shui compass .

A funny detail of this calendar is information about various "oracle systems". It doesn't matter whether it's about blinking at certain times or sneezing at a certain time. Everything is precisely documented and traced back to certain possible events.

Oracles and the resonances.

It is not only the Chinese who have a series of predictions about certain events; we also have many customs that are mostly dismissed as superstition today. Despite all this, many people adhere to them and some oracles even come true.

After all, we live in an environment of resonances. Everything we radiate, do and behave in can be interpreted and will result in events. Have fun with my oracle about sneezing. I look forward to hearing about your experiences.

 

Today I want to give you a special gift and introduce you to this simple oracle.

From today on, pay special attention to when and at what time you sneeze.
Have you ever sneezed without having a cold? There's an old saying: "Sneezing once means someone is thinking of you. Sneezing twice in a row means someone will scold you.
“Sneezing three times indicates that someone is talking about you.” In traditional Chinese folklore, sneezing is interpreted as a kind of preview of events.
 

Oracle Interpretation

Find out what sneezing at a certain time really means. The hourly interval is always two hours , as in Chinese astrology .

11pm-1am

Someone will invite you to eat with a large group of people. Take the opportunity to meet new friends.

1-3 o'clock

Someone misses you and wants to see you. So forget about feeling like no one cares about you.

3-5 o'clock

Your friend asks you if you want to go out to dinner together. After a heartfelt discussion with each other, your mood will improve.

5-7am

Surprising winnings await you. If you play the lottery now, your chances of winning will increase.

7-9am

Celebrations among lovers will arise. These will give wings to your soul and lift you to heaven.

9-11am

A friend asks you for a favor. Probably to borrow money. Think carefully before you agree.

11am-1pm

You will soon meet a benefactor. Build a good friendship because you never know when you will need his help.

1pm-3pm

Your ears will soon hear good news. Look forward to a celebration soon.

3-5pm

You are more susceptible to illness at this time. Pay attention to your health, especially the food you choose. Try to eat healthily to avoid digestive problems.

5-7pm

Someone wants to have a romantic meeting with you and this event will take place soon.

7-9pm

You are worried about someone close to you. Your concerns and worries prompt you to call the other party. In any case, the other person is happy to hear from you.

9-11pm

You meet someone with unfavorable circumstances. The meeting ends with you having no further fears. Look forward to more good things in your future.

items.title: Your window speaks to the eye of the beholder
items.summary: Feng Shui brings positive energy and harmony into the living space. There is a lot to consider when designing your own four walls according to the interior design concept. Not only furniture and decoration are taken into account. The windows also play an important role.
items.content_html:
Feng Shui brings positive energy and harmony into the living space. There is a lot to consider when designing your own four walls according to the interior design concept. Not only furniture and decoration are taken into account.

The windows also play an important role. In this article I will explain the principles of Feng Shui. You will also learn how to design your windows according to Feng Shui.

Windows are the eyes of your house; it doesn’t take much to see the world from a different perspective!

The principle behind Feng Shui

Feng Shui is a Chinese theory of harmony. It aims to create a balanced and harmonious environment. 

The principle behind it is based on the idea that the natural environment and the energy it radiates have a direct influence on our well-being and our life situations. 

By applying Feng Shui techniques, we can ensure that our home and work environment radiates positive energy and balance. 

Careful placement of furniture, use of certain colors and integration of natural materials can all help maintain Qi and therefore our well-being. 

Feng Shui can not only help to create a comfortable and balanced home, but it also influences our lives in a positive way.

What role do windows play in Feng Shui?

Windows are an important part of Feng Shui practice. They play a significant role in the circulation of energy in the room. 

The goal of Feng Shui is to design a room so that positive energy can flow freely. Windows can help with this by bringing fresh air and natural light into the room, thus getting the energy flowing. 

However, it is important that the windows are in proportion to the other furniture and kept clean to achieve the full potential of Feng Shui. 

In addition, you should not cover the windows with any curtains. A pleated blind in natural tones, for example, is a good option. But that's not all:

The right shape of the windows

In Feng Shui, the proportions of the windows have a special meaning. Tall, rectangular windows have an invigorating effect and bring a breath of fresh air into the room. 

Wide windows, on the other hand, create an atmosphere of stability and comfort. Round or square windows are particularly harmonious and give the room a gentle and balanced ambience. 

By choosing the right shape of the windows, you can not only add an aesthetic touch to the room, but also positively influence the energy and balance in the room.

Curtains, blinds and pleated blinds

Window coverings also play an important role in Feng Shui. Basically, they should not block the natural light and the view outside. 

In addition, they should be made of natural materials such as cotton, silk or linen and blend harmoniously with the colors of the surroundings. 

The way they are installed also plays a role: curtains should be wide and blinds should be narrow so as not to interrupt the energy. Pleated blinds are also particularly suitable. 

These are both functional and aesthetic. They can regulate natural light and thus create a relaxed and calming atmosphere in the room. They can also serve as protection against negative influences as they balance the energy. 

Pleated blinds come in different colors and materials so that they can be adapted to different interior design styles. In the LYSEL pleated blinds shop you will find a large selection of pleated blinds. With their versatility and beautiful appearance, they are an excellent choice for any Feng Shui interior.

Clean your windows and you will have a clear view of the future!

 

Further rules

In order to utilize the full potential of Chinese harmony, there are other general rules. For example, the windows should always be kept clean.

Curtains, pleated blinds, etc. should be opened during the day to allow light and fresh air to flow freely. 

Regular ventilation of the room is also very important to keep the energy in the room fresh and vital. It is also advisable not to place any furniture directly in front of the window to keep the view outside clear. With these simple tips you can improve the Feng Shui in your home and create a positive atmosphere.

The history of Feng Shui

Feng Shui is thousands of years old. The history of Feng Shui goes back to ancient China, where this art was kept as a secret by emperors and kings. 

Over time, the knowledge of Feng Shui has developed and spread. Even today, it is still practiced by many people all over the world. 

The basis of Feng Shui is the idea that everything in our lives is interconnected and needs balance to function optimally. 

By applying Feng Shui principles, we can not only make our environment more harmonious, but also improve our own well-being and quality of life.

Feng Shui in the rooms: The basic structures

Although there are many different teachings of Feng Shui, they all share certain fundamentals. 

One of the most important rules is the placement of furniture and objects in the room. Apartments and houses should be designed to create a pleasant atmosphere and make all rooms accessible to the Qi. A qualified Feng Shui consultant will take care of every detail of a living space and try to let the life energy flow gently.

In addition, all items in the home should be placed harmoniously and in a balanced way to create a peaceful and pleasant environment. Light also plays an important role. 

There should always be enough daylight in the rooms. The best way to regulate the natural brightness of a room is with products from a sun protection specialist retailer . Implementing Feng Shui can be a rewarding experience for anyone who wants to invite more positive energy into their home.

items.title: 3 Creative Hobbies for Seasonal Themes
items.summary: Feng Shui and Feng Shui are two areas that are closely related and complementary. Both are aimed at creating harmony, balance and positive energy in our environment. If you're looking for artistic hobbies to enjoy alone or with your family, creative pursuits can be both…
items.content_html:
Feng Shui and Feng Shui are two areas that are closely related and complementary. Both are aimed at creating harmony, balance and positive energy in our environment.

If you're looking for artistic hobbies to enjoy alone or with your family, creative pursuits can be both fun and relaxing.

Creativity helps you bring your inner values ​​to the outside.

They're also suitable for people of all ages and backgrounds. If you're feeling stuck and need inspiration for a fun activity, don't worry - there are plenty of options to choose from.

Considering exploring seasonal themes to guide your choice of creative hobbies? Paint by numbers is not only a fun creative hobby , but also a Feng Shui- friendly activity .

Why Feng Shui and painting play together?

Feng Shui is the Chinese philosophy that aims to create a harmonious balance between people and their environment.

The choice of colors  in art can play an important role in implementing Feng Shui principles. For example, the use of certain colors in a painting can help create a relaxing and harmonious atmosphere.

Painting by numbers allows you to choose the colors in your artwork to suit your surroundings.

In Feng Shui practice, art is considered an essential element as it can help activate or balance the energy of a space. Different forms of art such as paintings, sculptures or murals can be used to enhance specific areas of a room or home, depending on the principles of Feng Shui.

For example, a landscape painting with flowing water or a peaceful beach can enhance the water element and promote relaxation and calm. A vibrant abstract painting with bold colors can activate the fire element and bring energy and excitement to the room.

Painting by numbers: A fun and easy creative hobby for all seasons

If you're interested in exploring the world of paint by numbers, there are several e-commerce websites that offer a variety of options. For example, Figured'Art is a specialist in creative hobbies and offers a variety of paint by numbers themes to choose from. This activity allows you to unleash your creativity while following a structured process.

There are different categories available to accommodate certain preferences, such as animals , flowers, landscapes and romance. Painting by numbers is a practical and easy art form that can inspire you to create extraordinary paintings. Kits usually come with everything you need, such as paint pots, a high-quality numbered canvas, a miniature photo and brushes. You can also choose from a range of sizes and optional frames to display your finished masterpiece on a wall.

Painting by numbers for adults in good quality is not only a great way to be creative, but also an opportunity to turn your memories into works of art. You can even create a personalized canvas with a photo of your children, grandchildren or your wedding. It is a unique and original gift idea that encourages creativity.

Diamond Painting: A sparkling and relaxing creative hobby for all seasons

Diamond painting is another creative hobby that is designed around Feng Shui. The rhinestones used in this technique have a shiny and sparkling quality that can help create a positive energy in your space. Using rhinestones in certain colors can also help create a harmonious atmosphere based on Feng Shui principles. Diamond painting for adults is a very popular creative hobby that involves the use of 3D rhinestones to create stunning images just for your Feng Shui living room.

Even if you are not normally a fan of such hobbies, you are guaranteed to appreciate this manual activity for its simplicity.

To create art using this technique, you will need diamonds or rhinestones of different colors. Once you have these, you can start creating the picture using an adhesive canvas with a numbering system based on the pattern you want.

Luckily, the choice of diamond painting patterns is huge. You can choose from art reproductions, landscapes, animals and portraits. This means that you will undoubtedly find a pattern that inspires you and suits your preferences, making you want to start diamond painting.

Scratch pictures: A unique and expressive creative pastime for all seasons

If you're looking for a fun, seasonal art activity to enjoy with your family, consider scratch cards . It's an ideal choice if you have children , as it allows you to spend quality time together while encouraging creativity. Your little ones will love the opportunity to create their own scratch cards, and this activity is especially enjoyable for them as they get to make colorful drawings.

To get started, you will need to purchase the necessary items from a specialized website, such as oil pastels, special card paper (like Bristol card), washing-up liquid and acrylic paints. Once you have these, you can start making the scratch cards and enjoy the process with the whole family.

Overall, these creative hobbies not only provide a way to decorate the walls with artwork, but also a way to create a relaxing experience and promote positive energy in the home, which is in line with the concept of Feng Shui. In summary, art and Feng Shui are two areas that are connected and supportive of each other. Both strive to promote well-being and harmony in our lives.

No matter what creative hobby you choose, there are many ways to improve and expand your artistic skills. Trying different techniques and styles can help you hone your skills and learn new ones. Plus, learning a new hobby can boost your mental health and creativity by giving you a way to relieve stress and relax your mind. If you need a break from the daily routine or are just looking for a fun and creative activity, a seasonal creative hobby can be a great option.

The only way to put your thoughts into words is through the art of painting.

items.title: Feng Shui: A holistic experience for all senses
items.summary: The concept of Feng Shui is based on the idea that the environment in which we live has a direct impact on our health, well-being and success. A fascinating facet of Feng Shui is the ability to experience it with all of your senses, thus creating a…
items.content_html:
The concept of Feng Shui is based on the idea that the environment in which we live has a direct impact on our health, well-being and success. A fascinating facet of Feng Shui is the ability to experience it with all of your senses, thus creating a deeper connection to your surroundings.

 

Seeing: Colors and shapes

The visual component of Feng Shui is unmistakable. Colors and shapes play a crucial role in creating a balanced and harmonious space. Interior designers and Feng Shui consultants recommend color palettes that enhance the desired energy in a room.

An overview of the colors and their meanings:

  • Red represents passion, energy and prosperity. It is often used to promote wealth and luck. However, it should be used in moderation as too much red has an overstimulating effect.
  • Blue symbolizes calm, relaxation and serenity. It is often used to calm a room and create a peaceful atmosphere.
  • Green represents growth, renewal and health. It is often used to create a positive flow of energy and a connection to nature.
  • Yellow represents optimism, joy and intellect. The color helps to brighten a room and create a cheerful mood.
  • Violet represents spirituality, wisdom and transformation. It can be used to create a deeper connection to inner peace and the spiritual side.
  • White symbolizes purity, clarity and openness. It is often used to open up a room and create a neutral, balanced atmosphere.
  • Black represents power, depth and protection. Used in moderation, it conveys elegance and strength. However, when used excessively, it appears gloomy.
 

Shapes are also assigned a specific meaning:

  • The circle symbolizes unity, harmony and completeness. It promotes the flow of energy and is often used to create an even distribution of energy.
  • The square represents stability, structure and balance. It is used to create a solid base and stabilize energy.
  • The triangle symbolizes growth, change and progress. A triangle generates dynamic energy and drives movement forward.
  • The rectangle represents stability and structure, similar to the square. It is often used to balance elongated spaces.
  • Wavy lines promote the gentle flow of energy and calm a room through flowing movement.
  • Straight lines represent order and clarity. They provide a clear structure and direction in a room.

 

The use of colors and shapes in Feng Shui is context-dependent and depends on various factors such as the orientation of the room, its use and personal preferences. However, the conscious integration of colors and shapes can help to create a harmonious and balanced energy in the environment. A balanced energy should prevail especially in the Feng Shui living room , Feng Shui bedroom and the Feng Shui children's room .

 

Hearing: Sound and noises

Feng Shui also includes the sense of hearing. Sounds, noises and music influence the energy in a room. Gentle, calming sounds such as running water or quiet birdsong create a relaxed atmosphere.

In practice, wind chimes or singing bowls are used to create harmonious sounds and fill the room with positive energy. At the same time, disturbing noises should be minimized so as not to interrupt the flow of energy. Sounds are also used for energetic cleansing.

Music can be used to create the desired atmosphere in a room. Soft, soothing melodies can promote a relaxed and harmonious mood and help reduce stress.

In addition to bells, singing bowls and wind chimes, the handpan with its harmonious and mystical sound is also suitable as a Feng Shui instrument. Handpans are made of metal and are played directly with the hands. In addition to the sound, the feel is also an experience. It therefore combines several properties .

It is important to note that the choice of music is subjective and should be individually tailored to the preferences and needs of the people using the space. The intended energy and mood of the space must be considered when using sound and music.

Feel: texture and materials

Tactility plays an important role in experiencing Feng Shui with all of the senses. Smooth wood and soft fabrics create a welcoming atmosphere, while rougher textures can create a stronger presence. Consciously choosing materials that are pleasant to the touch will help create a positive sensory experience.

Natural materials such as wood, stone and clay add a sense of grounding and stability to a space. They can help create a solid base and stabilize energy. Incorporating other elements of nature, such as plants or water, can strengthen the connection to nature and bring a fresh, revitalizing energy into the space.

Certain materials sometimes have symbolic meaning. For example, metal represents clarity and precision, while water represents flow and movement. Consciously incorporating such materials helps to support specific energetic intentions.

The balance of the five elements (wood, fire, earth, metal and water) is also important. The clever selection of materials that represent the properties of these elements creates a balanced energy in the room.

Smell: scents and aromas

Certain aromas can have a calming and healing effect.

  • Lavender is known for its calming properties. It helps reduce stress and tension and promotes restful sleep.
  • Lemon scent has refreshing and invigorating properties. It helps to increase energy, promote concentration and create a positive mood.
  • The scent of eucalyptus has purifying and air-clearing properties. It dispels negative energies, facilitates breathing and creates a revitalizing effect.
  • Rosemary is stimulating and can improve mental clarity. It promotes concentration, improves memory and creates an energetic atmosphere.
  • Sandalwood scent has a calming and grounding effect. It creates a meditative mood and strengthens the connection to spirituality. This drives away negative thoughts.
  • Jasmine is often associated with love and sensuality. It can help promote romantic energies and lighten the mood.
  • The scent of mint has refreshing properties and stimulates the senses. It boosts energy and increases concentration.
  • Vanilla is known for its calming and comforting properties. Its cozy atmosphere reduces stress and creates a warm, inviting mood.

 

Aromatherapy and burning incense sticks provide a pleasant olfactory experience and help to harmonize the energy in the room. Frankincense or sage are used to drive away negative energies and clear the room energetically.

It is important to use scents sparingly and consciously to avoid an overwhelming or counterproductive effect.

Taste: Food and enjoyment

Although the sense of taste is not often associated with feng shui, it can still play a role. Healthy and balanced meals promote a sense of well-being, while sharing food in company creates positive social energy.

The way food is prepared and served affects the energy in the room. A tidy and organized dining area promotes a smooth distribution of energy. By enjoying meals mindfully, a deeper connection to the moment is created and the energy in the room is strengthened.

Certain foods can have symbolic meanings in Feng Shui. For example, oranges are often associated with luck and prosperity, while rice can represent abundance and fertility.

Conclusion

Overall, Feng Shui offers a fascinating way to experience our surroundings with all of our senses. By consciously incorporating colors, shapes, sounds, materials, scents and even taste, a balanced and harmonious atmosphere can be created in rooms. Although the effects may be subjective, there is no question that carefully designing our environment has a positive effect on our well-being.

items.title: The most effective Feng Shui system for your happiness
items.summary: One of my favorite and most effective Feng Shui systems is the "8 Houses" system. It is sometimes also called the Compass School. Don't miss out on this information. Influence your own luck and learn from me how to use the most effective Feng Shui…
items.content_html:
One of my favorite and most effective Feng Shui systems is the "8 Houses" system. It is sometimes also called the Compass School. Don't miss out on this information. Influence your own luck and learn from me how to use the most effective Feng Shui system.

Where do I get the knowledge about the effective Feng Shui system?

The 8-house system comes from Feng Shui . It is based on the harmony of the cardinal directions with the person. Grandmaster Yap Cheng Hai himself taught me how to use the 8-house formula. He repeatedly showed me its value and importance.

He himself had found the formula book in a library in China around 60 years ago. The forbidden books were sorted out there and kept in a kind of collection. According to him, it was written in southern China. It was a handwritten original from the Qing Dynasty.
He himself studied the work for more than three years in order to understand all the details and applications.

In principle, the application for the most effective Feng Shui system is very simple.

However, old works are often written in an encrypted or complicated way. This means that only experts can correctly interpret and understand the content. Furthermore, the Chinese language is a figurative language. It leaves a lot of room for possible interpretations.

Through his work with friends and clients, Grandmaster Yap Cheng Hai gained another twenty years of experience in this Feng Shui technique. This led him to realize that this book contained a great treasure. Anyone who understood how to use it could influence problems in the areas of family, business or health. I can confirm its effectiveness through my own experience.

What is the most effective Feng Shui system?

  • The Feng Shui of the 8 houses is based on the personal birth data as well as the location and orientation of the house.
  • Its goal is to find and use the best directional energies of each person and to avoid the bad ones.
  • Each person reacts in different ways to the forces of different directions.

Learn how to give yourself targeted advice in my Feng Shui course “Be your own Feng Shui consultant”.

Method

In order to be able to use Ba Zhai for yourself, you first need to understand how the Chinese calendar works . Every qualified Feng Shui consultant needs a compass but also a calendar.
Unlike the western division of the year, the Chinese calendar is divided into two different types of calculation: namely, the lunar and solar times.

In the Western calendar, the New Year always begins on January 1st - unlike the Chinese view. Here, the solar calendar begins the year around February 4th. In the lunar calendar, on the other hand, the year begins according to the phases of the moon.

In Feng Shui, the solar calendar is used exclusively for most important calculations.

Thus, the year usually begins on February 4th, sometimes also on February 3rd or 5th. All people born before February 4th usually still belong to the previous year.

The birth times can be compared using the table below. However, for the assessment it is important to know that this system is based on the solar year. From the table, each person can now be assigned a Gua number. This is needed for the precise assessment in order to determine which areas and directions are most favorable for you.

First, find your Gua number from the list below. Note that men and women have a different column. The blue column is for men and boys, the red column is for women and girls. Write down your number!

For the most effective Feng Shui system you need  compass measurement

Authentic Feng Shui deals with the powerful but invisible energies of our environment. The precision compass used by Feng Shui consultants is called Luo Pan and helps to understand the energy flow of an area. This enables a qualitative assessment of a place.

There are numerous rings on the Luo Pan, from which many Feng Shui formulas can be derived. But there are also references to cardinal directions and their qualities. Of course, it is also possible to use a good, precise compass for the measurement.

Unlike Google Earth, Feng Shui works exclusively with the earth's magnetism. Google Earth and other maps are aligned to geographic north.

Each direction has its own qualities of Qi

The Chinese name for the Feng Shui system of 8 houses is "Ba Zhai". Ba means "8" and Zhai means "house".
You divide your house into 8 different sectors. But there are actually 9 fields.
You can then place these on your floor plan. This allows you to specifically assess which direction corresponds exactly to your energy, your Qi quality.

The middle is not important in this Feng Shui system. You probably already know the basics of Feng Shui, which say: The middle should be free. That is always the basic principle.
That is why it is called 8 houses. Because there are 8 different directions and therefore 8 different sectors to evaluate and not 9. This gives you 8 possibilities for how you interact with your room.
First of all, we will try to find out exactly what the most effective Feng Shui system is.

Then you can get started.

You have and absolutely need a house or an apartment , a kind of enclosure for Qi, so to speak. Next, you need the birth date of the residents; each individual roommate.

Because here too, it is important to differentiate carefully. After all, not everyone prefers the same cardinal directions, which can also be an advantage. Just imagine that you might not be able to use some rooms because they do not support your energy. Every Feng Shui living room , Feng Shui bedroom and especially a Feng Shui children's room should have good Qi. But perhaps the situation is different for your child or another family member.
Mark the good areas of your favorable sectors and the corresponding cardinal directions.

SE – southeast, NE – northeast, S – south, N – north, W – west, SW – southwest, NW – northwest, E – east.

In the first line you will find your Gua number. Below are the cardinal directions. The blue values ​​indicate the good sectors. The red letters represent the bad areas in your house.

Find your good areas in the house or apartment

To easily assess your living space, ask yourself the following questions: Where are your seats? Which room do you spend most of your time in? Is your sleeping area in a good sector?

The following list shows you which places should be in a good sector for you.

In the Feng Shui bedroom and also in the Feng Shui children's room, the bed is particularly important. So the bed should be in a positive area. Do you often spend time in the office and make important decisions there? Then the desk should be in a good sector.

Your Feng Shui living room and especially the place where the couch is located needs good qualities of Qi. This is where you want to recharge your energy and regenerate. This happens best when you and your positive direction interact. Your dining room and the places in the house where you spend a lot of time also need good qualities of Qi.

items.title: How you can reduce electrosmog in your home
items.summary: Radiation and electrosmog arise in your own four walls in two ways: electrically and magnetically. Electric fields arise in the house where there is a measurable voltage. Magnetic fields only become active when current flows. To put it simply, radiation is created when the light…
items.content_html:
Radiation and electrosmog arise in your own four walls in two ways: electrically and magnetically.

Electric fields arise in the house where there is a measurable voltage. Magnetic fields only become active when current flows.

To put it simply, radiation is created when the light switch is pressed or the household appliance is turned on.

The following article will explain which household appliance is the biggest smog offender at home and how consumers can protect themselves from electrosmog in their own home.

Who is the electrosmog slinger in private households?

When it comes to electrosmog at home, it is not possible to spontaneously identify a culprit because there is a variety of data that must be available in order to identify which device is causing electrosmog at home.

Transformers and electric motors are crucial because they can generate magnetic fields even at low current levels. 

Radiation exposure can be measured using broadband measuring devices. If you want to use this to initially find out the radiation exposure in the house or on certain devices, you will probably find out that the magnetic field increases with the strength of the current. Even more complex technologies, such as those installed in a dimmer, can lead to higher levels of electrosmog.

It makes sense to examine radiation exposure in your own home at the latest when health consequences are already foreseeable. 

So anyone who constantly suffers from headaches, is tired, doesn't sleep well and shows other non-specific symptoms of this kind could check how high their radiation exposure really is at home.

Since the radiation itself is invisible and Wi-Fi and smartphones are not the only sources of electrosmog, a surprise could arise with seemingly harmless devices. Multiple sockets, smart TVs, baby monitors and clock radios could also cause electrosmog at home

These measures help to reduce radiation exposure at home

There are a number of measures that can help reduce radiation exposure at home. 

This starts with renting or buying a place to stay. If the high-voltage line is far away, the radiation exposure is lower. Anyone who moves in should have the electrical installation carried out by a specialist who can lay cables in a low-radiation manner and may even recommend a mains isolator. 

In everyday life, electrosmog can be reduced by switching off unused devices. When using a smartphone, the following also applies: only make calls if the reception is good and the radiation is therefore low. 

A headset reduces direct strain on the head. If you don't need them, you should deactivate updates that run continuously in the background or only use them for longer periods of time. This reduces radiation exposure.

Shielding

There are other sensible purchases in the online shop for electrosmog shielding , which can often reduce the harmful radiation in a particularly nice way. 

With a special canopy over the bed, radiation can be shielded in the bedroom, for example. Special curtains can also actively help keep the invisible rays away from the people in the room. 

Using shielding paint on the walls can reduce high-frequency electromagnetic radiation throughout an entire room.

I also strongly recommend that you carry out a measurement in advance with a subject matter expert who can take appropriate measurements. If you need assistance finding an expert, I will be happy to help.

Clothing - from T-shirts, shirts, boxer shorts and pajamas to hoodies, shorts and scarves to headscarves, caps and hats - is also offered to reduce radiation exposure. However, you should be careful if you wear protective clothing, the high-frequency radiation can be reflected in your body many times, for example under your shirt. Clothing can only be recommended in very specific cases, e.g. B. in X-ray diagnostics.

You can also find other shielding options at Gigahertz Solution .

Using shielding paint on the walls can reduce high-frequency electromagnetic radiation throughout an entire room

Tips for a happy home

The combination of these measures to reduce radiation and these Feng Shui tips for a happier home can sustainably optimize well-being in the home.

  • For example, following the teachings of Feng Shui, the entrance area should be designed to be open and accessible. Creaking doors disrupt the atmosphere, as does the radiation emitted by a smart home system, for example.
  • In the center of the house, usually in the living area, attention should be paid to delicate furnishings that allow the energy to circulate. Although very few living areas are free of technology, it helps to interrupt the flow of electricity when it is not being used. By the way, fresh flowers and order, which shows attentiveness, are much nicer to look at than a black television.
  • In the Feng Shui bedroom and in the Feng Shui children's room, electrical appliances are taboo according to the teachings of Feng Shui and with regard to radiation exposure. Mirrors should also not be hung in the bedroom, as they bring turmoil into the room instead of enabling restful sleep.
  • The kitchen is ideally sized to accommodate a dining table. Small feasts can be enjoyed here as a family – ideally with fresh food that adds color and freshness to the table. If the kitchen is designed so that the stove is placed right next to the sink, a bamboo plant will help reduce the conflict between fire and water.
  • The Feng Shui living room is also responsible for family gatherings and relaxing in the evening. Bright and light colors often have a relaxing effect or beautiful Feng Shui decoration brings balance to your professional life.

How dangerous is electrosmog in your own four walls?

According to various statements, if  the radiation remains below the limit values ​​set by the Federal Office for Radiation Protection , there is no immediate health risk.

However, it remains confirmed that electrosmog can have an impact on the body. In a healthy body, radiation can cause the body to heat up. 

However, the radiation could have negative effects on a pacemaker. The limits were first formulated in 1997 and leveled in 2013. 

The aim is to reduce the heat load on the body so that no health-relevant disadvantages result. There is, however, a restriction because this regulation only applies to so-called fixed systems, i.e. radio systems owned by private individuals, radar systems and radio stations. However, everyone has to protect themselves from electrosmog in their own four walls.

Central meeting room living room

The  Feng Shui living room  is the place in the home where family members and friends meet and is therefore a good place to place the television. Power Position is the name of the place from which it is seen. This should be chosen so that windows, doors and the television are clearly visible.

Order and harmonious  Feng Shui decoration  are an essential part of  Feng Shui  and therefore the television as such should not immediately attract all the attention. So understatement is required here.

An ideal solution could be to attach the  electronics , which today are only a few centimeters deep,   directly to the wall or to a wooden panel using a wall mount for televisions .

The second solution also ensures that the cables disappear behind the wood, thus ensuring order again.  How all the elements can be reconciled can best   be determined in a Feng Shui consultation .

Electrical appliances in Feng Shui in the bedroom

Electrical appliances have   no place in the Feng Shui bedroom . Electrosmog is the number one calm killer and stress trigger. The electromagnetic and  high-frequency fields are to blame for this , while at the same time the sensitivity is 50 times higher.

If you don't want to be without your cell phone next to your pillow because the alarm clock is supposed to go off the next morning, it's best to switch to airplane mode to limit the radiation.

For other electrical devices, you can start by using a power strip that can be switched off separately. When it comes to the power strip, however, it is important to ensure that it itself should be used in a shielded form.

Ideally, there are no electrical appliances in the bedroom according to Feng Shui.

The power lines in the wall, which you cannot escape, can be stopped using a mains circuit breaker. You should definitely ask a specialist for advice here.

Waterbeds are another disruptive factor for restful sleep. Not only does the electricity disturb the body, the heating pipes in particular generate electrical fields. Since we cannot exclude electric fields in our environment, it is always advisable to choose a bed and  mattress  that does not contain any metal parts. Because metal, like water, conducts electric fields.

Avoid genetic damage when using the phone

According to scientists, the blood-brain barrier is broken after just a few minutes of using a cell phone. This can lead to the destruction of nerve cells, especially since proteins and toxins can penetrate. In experiments with chicken eggs, increased genetic damage was found with permanent high-frequency radiation.

Since we all like to use our smartphones, it is particularly advisable to keep a distance of 2 m from your body when making calls.

Also note that headphones that are not shielded transmit these fields directly into your ear.

The same applies to the laptop, because we associate it with work and so we literally take it to bed with us. At some point you may be able to do without the television.  What sleep researchers have discovered is that the body can be conditioned. If you use the bedroom exclusively for sleeping over a certain period of time   , problems falling asleep and staying asleep are reduced.

More protection against electrosmog with Waveguard

Shielding from electrosmog is not always possible. Plus, there are a lot of products on the market that just don't work. This is where Qi technology comes into play, which can have a supportive and harmonizing effect thanks to natural light frequencies. It helps to reduce your personal electromagnetic fields and thus balance the influence of unnatural frequencies on your body.

The devices use a special liquid to transform the artificial radiation from cell phones, WiFi and Bluetooth back into natural radiation.

The effect of the devices arises from a physical principle of action, depolarization.

What is depolarization?

To put it simply: depolarization means that focused and polarized artificial radiation is converted into a more natural state. Natural radiation is flat and unpolarized, which means it has no direction of rotation. The depolarization is made possible by the specially developed liquid, Qi-Liquid.

Imagine it like a very thin laser beam hitting the liquid. The liquid transforms this beam and a gentle light emerges from the liquid. Simply put, the liquid does the opposite of what a magnifying glass would do.

By converting the radiation, the field strength in the electromagnetic field is reduced. This means that a more natural environment is created to ensure radiation protection.

This means you can take advantage of the latest technology without worry, while giving yourself and your loved ones a protected home.

items.title: Pain Relief: How Feng Shui Can Help Prevent Headaches
items.summary: Discover Feng Shui for headache relief. Harmonize your home and experience how the flow of Qi significantly increases your well-being. Headaches are an ailment that many of us experience in our hectic everyday lives. While searching for alternative methods of relief, I came across the…
items.content_html:
Discover Feng Shui for headache relief. Harmonize your home and experience how the flow of Qi significantly increases your well-being.

Headaches are an ailment that many of us experience in our hectic everyday lives. While searching for alternative methods of relief, I came across the ancient Chinese art of Feng Shui 30 years ago. Feng Shui, which means “wind and water,” aims to create harmony between people and their surroundings. At the core of Feng Shui is the concept of Qi, a life-giving energy that flows through everything. By carefully designing our living and working spaces, we can optimize the flow of Qi and create an environment that promotes our well-being.

In this article I would like to explore the fascinating connection between Feng Shui, Qi and headache prevention. I will introduce basic principles of Feng Shui and share practical applications on how you can use this ancient wisdom to create a harmonious environment that may help prevent and relieve headaches. Join me on this insightful journey and discover new ways to improve your overall well-being!

Summary: 10 Facts About Feng Shui for Headache Relief

  1. Feng Shui is a traditional Chinese art that can promote well-being by harmonizing the flow of Qi in living and working spaces .
  2. Feng Shui room design , including positioning furniture and avoiding blockages, can improve energy flow and reduce stress . A Feng Shui bedroom will bring you relaxation and strengthen your strength.
  3. Color therapy is an important aspect of Feng Shui, where calming colors such as blue and green can help create a relaxing environment.
  4. Acupuncture is a traditional Chinese medicine practice that can be helpful for various pain conditions, including headaches.
  5. Meditation can calm the mind, reduce stress, and improve awareness of physical signals, which can be helpful in preventing and treating headaches.
  6. Yoga combines physical postures, breathing exercises and meditation to relieve muscle tension and improve flexibility.
  7. A holistic approach to pain relief integrates both the external environment as well as internal practices and self-care.
  8. Plants can be used in Feng Shui to invigorate Qi, with plants with rounded leaves being preferred.
  9. Mirrors and good lighting are other Feng Shui elements that can support Qi flow and improve room energy.
  10. Combining Feng Shui principles with complementary natural healing methods such as acupuncture, meditation and yoga can promote a harmonious lifestyle and help provide natural pain relief.

The basics of Feng Shui

Feng Shui is a traditional Chinese art that has been practiced for thousands of years to create harmony between people and their surroundings. The name Feng Shui literally translates to “wind and water ,” and these two elements symbolize the flow of energy , or Qi, through our surroundings. It is the art of designing our environment to optimize the flow of Qi to promote prosperity, health and harmony. A harmonious flow of Qi can also help to relieve or prevent ailments such as tension headaches. The fundamentals of Feng Shui are deeply rooted in Chinese philosophy and the observation of nature. Here are some key concepts you should know:

  1. The concept of Qi: Qi is the life-giving energy that flows through everything. A harmonious flow of Qi in your Feng Shui living room or at work can contribute to improved general well-being.
  2. The Five Elements: Feng Shui is based on the theory of the five elements – wood, fire, earth, metal and water. The balance and interaction of these elements in your environment influences the Qi and thus your well-being.
  3. Yin and Yang: The balance of Yin and Yang , the opposing and complementary forces, is crucial to creating a harmonious environment.
  4. The Bagua Card: The Bagua Card is a fundamental tool in Feng Shui and helps identify different areas of life and their connection to different parts of your living or working space.

Compass school or form school: Feng Shui practices can be divided into compass schools , which focus on directional energies and time qualities, and form schools , which focus on the physical design and arrangement of spaces. Both systems should be used in good Feng Shui advice .

By applying these basics, you can begin to understand and optimize the energy flows in your environment. Feng Shui offers a rich range of tools and techniques to improve the quality of Qi in your living space, creating a harmonious and supportive environment . Any change, no matter how small, can be a significant step in promoting balance and positive energy in your daily life. The art of Feng Shui can create a deeper connection between you and your living space, which lays the foundation for a balanced and healthy life .

Feng Shui to prevent headaches

The traditional art of Feng Shui offers a range of tools and techniques that can help you create a harmonious environment that promotes well-being . This harmony can have a positive effect on preventing headaches .

By consciously designing your living and work spaces, you can create a supportive space that can reduce the frequency and severity of headaches. In the following sections, I will discuss the key aspects of room design and color therapy in Feng Shui and their potential impact on headaches.

Spatial design and flow of Qi

Interior design plays a central role in the practice of Feng Shui, and the goal is to promote life energy. A steady and harmonious flow of Qi can help promote overall well-being and possibly prevent headaches. The arrangement of furniture , the selection of beautiful Feng Shui decorations and the general organization of the room can influence you.

The clarity and order in a room can help reduce stress and therefore the likelihood of headaches. A neat and clearly designed space allows for an unobstructed flow of Qi , creating a relaxing and supportive environment. It is also advisable to avoid blockages and clutter as these can inhibit the flow of energy and cause stress.

Another important consideration is the positioning of furniture and other objects in a room. Avoiding sharp edges and creating open spaces can also help. The direction in which furniture faces or is aligned is also important. Harmonious room design can help prevent headaches and create a calming environment.

Color therapy and its potential effect on headaches

Colors have a special meaning in Feng Shui and can influence the energy of a room. They can alsoaffect emotions and overall well-being , providing a potential solution to headache prevention .

Choosing calming colors can have a relaxing effect and help create a stress-free environment.

Choosing calming colors can have a relaxing effect and help create a stress-free environment.

For example, blue and green are colors associated with calm and healing. They can help create a relaxing and calming atmosphere, potentially reducing the frequency of headaches.

On the other hand, bright colors such as intense red or orange can in some cases be perceived as stimulating or even annoying and therefore do not help relieve headaches.

Using color therapy in Feng Shui is an individual journey. It is important to choose colors that give you a feeling of calm and balance. By experimenting with different colors and observing how they affect your mood and well-being, you can find a color palette that helps prevent headaches and creates a harmonious environment.

Steps to optimize living and working areas

Optimizing spaces is a central element of Feng Shui and can help create a harmonious and healthy environment . Such an environment can, in turn, help relieve or prevent headaches and other ailments. Here are some concrete steps you can take to optimize chi flow in your living and work spaces:

  1. Tidying up and decluttering: Start by clearing your rooms of clutter. Clutter can block and cause stress. A tidy, well-organized space allows for a free and harmonious flow of energy.
  2. Furniture positioning: Position your furniture so that it supports you and doesn't block you. Avoid placing furniture directly in front of doors or in narrow passageways. The positioning of the furniture should also promote communication and interaction between people. A Feng Shui children's room in particular should be individually designed for your child in order to strengthen their health.
  3. Using Plants: Live plants can help enliven the space and improve air quality. Choose plants with rounded leaves and avoid plants with pointed or spiky leaves, as these are considered negative energy.
  4. Influence of colors: As already mentioned in color therapy, colors can influence the energy of a room. Use calming colors to create a relaxing and harmonious environment.
  5. Use of mirrors: Mirrors can visually enlarge rooms. However, place them so that they don't reflect sharp edges or unpleasant views.
  6. Pay attention to good lighting: Good lighting is crucial for a positive energy flow. Use natural light sources wherever possible and complement them with warm artificial lighting to brighten dark corners.
  7. Establish quiet zones: Create areas where you can relax and unwind . Quiet zones help to calm you down and offer you a place to relax.
  8. Regular ventilation: Fresh air is important for your lungs and your vitality. Ventilate your rooms regularly to improve air quality and avoid stagnant energy.
  9. Using Feng Shui Treatments : You can also use specific Feng Shui treatments such as crystals, water features, or wind chimes to optimize space and promote balance and harmony in your rooms. This often requires the professional expertise of a Feng Shui consultant .

By following these steps, you can make a big contribution to optimizing your living and working areas. Not only will this improve the quality of your environment, but it can also help reduce the frequency and severity of headaches by creating a supportive and relaxing environment.

Other natural methods for pain relief

In addition to optimizing the flow of chi through Feng Shui, there are other natural methods that can help relieve pain . These methods can be a useful addition to promote a harmonious balance between body and mind and thus improve the quality of life. Some additional approaches as well as the importance of a holistic approach to pain relief are discussed below.

Complementary approaches such as acupuncture, meditation and yoga

Acupuncture is a traditional Chinese medical practice that is intended to activate the body's self-healing powers and restore energetic balance by inserting needles into specific points on the body . It can be helpful for various pain conditions, including headaches, and is often recommended as a safe method of pain relief.

Meditation is a practice that aims to calm the mind and increase awareness. Through regular meditation, you can learn to better deal with stress, which can be a major cause of tension headaches. Meditation can also help you develop a deeper awareness of your body's signals and thus respond better to pain.

Yoga is another complementary method that involves both the body and the mind. Combining physical postures, breathing exercises, and meditation can help relieve muscle tension, improve flexibility, and promote an overall sense of well-being. Yoga can be particularly helpful for relieving tension that can cause headaches.

The importance of a holistic approach to pain relief

A holistic approach to pain relief recognizes that the body and mind are connected and that healing must begin on different levels. By combining Feng Shui with other natural healing methods, you can take a more comprehensive approach to pain relief and promoting overall well-being.

Integrating various natural healing methods can provide an effective strategy for managing and preventing pain.

It's about creating a supportive environment while learning tools to help you better deal with pain and stress.

Promoting a harmonious lifestyle through the application of Feng Shui principles, coupled with regular practice of yoga, meditation and possibly acupuncture, can be a powerful method to promote overall well-being and support natural pain relief. By looking at the bigger picture and adopting a holistic approach, you can find a positive path to pain relief and a better quality of life.

Conclusion: Harmony as the key to headache relief

Throughout this article, we have explored the many ways that the principles of Feng Shui , along with other natural healing methods, can help prevent and relieve headaches . Harmonization in our living and working spaces, coupled with complementary approaches such as acupuncture , meditation and yoga , offers a holistic path to pain relief and promoting general well-being.

An ancient wisdom from Feng Shui teaches us that “When you change the conditions in your external life, there is a corresponding change in your internal life.”

This underlines the importance of a balanced and harmonious environment for our health and well-being.

Taking a holistic approach to pain relief, taking into account both the external environment and internal balance and self-care, is a powerful approach to improving quality of life.

Consciously shaping our surroundings, being mindful of our body and mind, and opening up to complementary natural healing methods can together make a significant difference in our experience of well-being and pain relief.

By applying the principles of Feng Shui and embracing a variety of natural healing methods, we create a solid foundation for a healthy, harmonious life. This holistic approach allows us to take control of our well-being and actively work to improve our quality of life. This is how the path of harmony and balance leads us to a fulfilled and pain-free life.
